    • Method Detail

      • loadLines

        public static List<String> loadLines(File file,
                     Charset cs)
                              throws IOException
        Loads a file, returning the contents as a Collection of lines.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to load.
        cs - A charset.
        Returns:
        The lines in the specified file, as a Set.
        Throws:
        {@link - IOException} If the file can't be opened or read.
        {@link - java.io.FileNotFoundException} If the file can't be found.
        {@link - NullPointerException} If file is null.
        IOException

      • loadLines

        public static <T extends Collection<String>> T loadLines(File file,
                                         T lines,
                                         Charset cs)
                                      throws IOException
        Loads a file, storing the contents in the supplied collection, line-by-line. This allows the calling code to perform sorting or deduplication as desired at the time the files are loaded by providing a Set or Sorted Collection, depending on the calling code's needs.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to load.
        lines - The collection to store files in.
        cs - A charset.
        Returns:
        The lines in the specified file, as a Collection.
        Throws:
        {@link - IOException} If the file can't be opened or read.
        {@link - java.io.FileNotFoundException} If the file can't be found.
        {@link - NullPointerException} If any argument is null.
        IOException
